2.1: How the Lord has covered the daughter of Zion With a cloud in His anger! He has cast from heaven to earth The glory of Israel, And has not remembered His footstool In the day of His anger.
2.9: Her gates have sunk into the ground, He has destroyed and broken her bars. Her king and her princes are among the nations; The law is no more. Also, her prophets find No vision from the LORD.

2.7: The Lord has rejected His altar, He has abandoned His sanctuary; He has delivered into the hand of the enemy The walls of her palaces. They have made a noise in the house of the LORD As in the day of an appointed feast.
2.15: All who pass along the way Clap their hands [in derision] at you; They hiss and shake their heads At the daughter of Jerusalem, 'Is this the city of which they said, 'The perfection of beauty, A joy to all the earth '?'

2.6: And He has violently treated His tabernacle like a garden [booth]; He has destroyed His appointed meeting place. The LORD has caused to be forgotten The appointed feast and sabbath in Zion, And He has despised king and priest In the indignation of His anger.
2.4: He has bent His bow like an enemy; He has set His right hand like an adversary And slain all that were pleasant to the eye; In the tent of the daughter of Zion He has poured out His wrath like fire.
2.19: 'Arise, cry aloud in the night At the beginning of the night watches; Pour out your heart like water Before the presence of the Lord; Lift up your hands to Him For the life of your little ones Who are faint because of hunger At the head of every street.'
2.13: How shall I admonish you? To what shall I compare you, O daughter of Jerusalem? To what shall I liken you as I comfort you, O virgin daughter of Zion? For your ruin is as vast as the sea; Who can heal you?

4.16: The presence of the LORD has scattered them, He will not continue to regard them; They did not honor the priests, They did not favor the elders.
4.3: Even jackals offer the breast, They nurse their young; [But] the daughter of my people has become cruel Like ostriches in the wilderness.
4.5: Those who ate delicacies Are desolate in the streets; Those reared in purple Embrace ash pits.

4.18: They hunted our steps So that we could not walk in our streets; Our end drew near, Our days were finished For our end had come.
4.12: The kings of the earth did not believe, Nor [did] any of the inhabitants of the world, That the adversary and the enemy Could enter the gates of Jerusalem.
4.10: The hands of compassionate women Boiled their own children; They became food for them Because of the destruction of the daughter of my people.
4.2: The precious sons of Zion, Weighed against fine gold, How they are regarded as earthen jars, The work of a potter's hands!

4.8: Their appearance is blacker than soot, They are not recognized in the streets; Their skin is shriveled on their bones, It is withered, it has become like wood.

4.11: The LORD has accomplished His wrath, He has poured out His fierce anger; And He has kindled a fire in Zion Which has consumed its foundations.
4.1: How dark the gold has become, [How] the pure gold has changed! The sacred stones are poured out At the corner of every street.
4.9: Better are those slain with the sword Than those slain with hunger; For they pine away, being stricken For lack of the fruits of the field.
4.14: They wandered, blind, in the streets; They were defiled with blood So that no one could touch their garments.
4.7: Her consecrated ones were purer than snow, They were whiter than milk; They were more ruddy [in] body than corals, Their polishing [was like] lapis lazuli.
4.15: 'Depart! Unclean!' they cried of themselves. 'Depart, depart, do not touch!' So they fled and wandered; [Men] among the nations said, 'They shall not continue to dwell [with us].'
4.20: The breath of our nostrils, the LORD'S anointed, Was captured in their pits, Of whom we had said, 'Under his shadow We shall live among the nations.'
4.6: For the iniquity of the daughter of my people Is greater than the sin of Sodom, Which was overthrown as in a moment, And no hands were turned toward her.
4.4: The tongue of the infant cleaves To the roof of its mouth because of thirst; The little ones ask for bread, [But] no one breaks [it] for them.
4.19: Our pursuers were swifter Than the eagles of the sky; They chased us on the mountains, They waited in ambush for us in the wilderness.
4.13: Because of the sins of her prophets [And] the iniquities of her priests, Who have shed in her midst The blood of the righteous;

5.16: The crown has fallen from our head; Woe to us, for we have sinned!
5.3: We have become orphans without a father, Our mothers are like widows.
5.5: Our pursuers are at our necks; We are worn out, there is no rest for us.
5.21: Restore us to You, O LORD, that we may be restored; Renew our days as of old,
5.18: Because of Mount Zion which lies desolate, Foxes prowl in it.
5.12: Princes were hung by their hands; Elders were not respected.
5.10: Our skin has become as hot as an oven, Because of the burning heat of famine.
5.2: Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers, Our houses to aliens.
5.22: Unless You have utterly rejected us [And] are exceedingly angry with us.
5.8: Slaves rule over us; There is no one to deliver us from their hand.
5.17: Because of this our heart is faint, Because of these things our eyes are dim;
5.11: They ravished the women in Zion, The virgins in the cities of Judah.
5.1: Remember, O LORD, what has befallen us; Look, and see our reproach!
5.9: We get our bread at the risk of our lives Because of the sword in the wilderness.
5.14: Elders are gone from the gate, Young men from their music.
5.7: Our fathers sinned, [and] are no more; It is we who have borne their iniquities.
5.15: The joy of our hearts has ceased; Our dancing has been turned into mourning.
5.20: Why do You forget us forever? Why do You forsake us so long?
5.6: We have submitted to Egypt [and] Assyria to get enough bread.
5.4: We have to pay for our drinking water, Our wood comes [to us] at a price.
5.19: You, O LORD, rule forever; Your throne is from generation to generation.
5.13: Young men worked at the grinding mill, And youths stumbled under [loads] of wood.

1.16: 'For these things I weep; My eyes run down with water; Because far from me is a comforter, One who restores my soul. My children are desolate Because the enemy has prevailed.'
1.3: Judah has gone into exile under affliction And under harsh servitude; She dwells among the nations, [But] she has found no rest; All her pursuers have overtaken her In the midst of distress.
1.5: Her adversaries have become her masters, Her enemies prosper; For the LORD has caused her grief Because of the multitude of her transgressions; Her little ones have gone away As captives before the adversary.
1.21: 'They have heard that I groan; There is no one to comfort me; All my enemies have heard of my calamity; They are glad that You have done [it]. Oh, that You would bring the day which You have proclaimed, That they may become like me.
1.18: 'The LORD is righteous; For I have rebelled against His command; Hear now, all peoples, And behold my pain; My virgins and my young men Have gone into captivity.
1.12: 'Is it nothing to all you who pass this way? Look and see if there is any pain like my pain Which was severely dealt out to me, Which the LORD inflicted on the day of His fierce anger.
1.10: The adversary has stretched out his hand Over all her precious things, For she has seen the nations enter her sanctuary, The ones whom You commanded That they should not enter into Your congregation.
1.2: She weeps bitterly in the night And her tears are on her cheeks; She has none to comfort her Among all her lovers. All her friends have dealt treacherously with her; They have become her enemies.
1.22: 'Let all their wickedness come before You; And deal with them as You have dealt with me For all my transgressions; For my groans are many and my heart is faint.'
1.8: Jerusalem sinned greatly, Therefore she has become an unclean thing. All who honored her despise her Because they have seen her nakedness; Even she herself groans and turns away.
1.17: Zion stretches out her hands; There is no one to comfort her; The LORD has commanded concerning Jacob That the ones round about him should be his adversaries; Jerusalem has become an unclean thing among them.
1.11: All her people groan seeking bread; They have given their precious things for food To restore their lives themselves. 'See, O LORD, and look, For I am despised.'
1.1: How lonely sits the city That was full of people! She has become like a widow Who was [once] great among the nations! She who was a princess among the provinces Has become a forced laborer!
1.9: Her uncleanness was in her skirts; She did not consider her future. Therefore she has fallen astonishingly; She has no comforter. 'See, O LORD, my affliction, For the enemy has magnified himself!'
1.14: 'The yoke of my transgressions is bound; By His hand they are knit together. They have come upon my neck; He has made my strength fail. The Lord has given me into the hands Of [those against whom] I am not able to stand.
1.7: In the days of her affliction and homelessness Jerusalem remembers all her precious things That were from the days of old, When her people fell into the hand of the adversary And no one helped her. The adversaries saw her, They mocked at her ruin.
1.15: 'The Lord has rejected all my strong men In my midst; He has called an appointed time against me To crush my young men; The Lord has trodden [as in] a wine press The virgin daughter of Judah.
1.20: 'See, O LORD, for I am in distress; My spirit is greatly troubled; My heart is overturned within me, For I have been very rebellious. In the street the sword slays; In the house it is like death.
1.6: All her majesty Has departed from the daughter of Zion; Her princes have become like deer That have found no pasture; And they have fled without strength Before the pursuer.
1.4: The roads of Zion are in mourning Because no one comes to the appointed feasts. All her gates are desolate; Her priests are groaning, Her virgins are afflicted, And she herself is bitter.
1.19: 'I called to my lovers, [but] they deceived me; My priests and my elders perished in the city While they sought food to restore their strength themselves.
1.13: 'From on high He sent fire into my bones, And it prevailed [over them]. He has spread a net for my feet; He has turned me back; He has made me desolate, Faint all day long.

3.28: Let him sit alone and be silent Since He has laid [it] on him.

3.66: You will pursue them in anger and destroy them From under the heavens of the LORD!

3.41: We lift up our heart and hands Toward God in heaven;

3.34: To crush under His feet All the prisoners of the land,
3.6: In dark places He has made me dwell, Like those who have long been dead.

3.1: I am the man who has seen affliction Because of the rod of His wrath.

3.33: For He does not afflict willingly Or grieve the sons of men.

3.64: You will recompense them, O LORD, According to the work of their hands.

3.39: Why should [any] living mortal, or [any] man, Offer complaint in view of his sins?

3.15: He has filled me with bitterness, He has made me drunk with wormwood.
